channel.title: BBC News - Entertainment & Arts

item.title: Love Island: Faye and Teddy's row sparks record 25,000 Ofcom complaints
item.description: Faye and Teddy's Casa Amor row sparks the highest number of Ofcom complaints in the show's history.

item.title: Instagram says sorry for removing Pedro Almodovar film poster
item.description: The advert for revered Spanish director Pedro Almodovar's new film features a lactating nipple.

item.title: Johnny Depp's film festival awards insulting, domestic abuse charities say
item.description: The actor, labelled a "wife beater" by The Sun, is to be honoured in Spain and the Czech Republic.

item.title: Stevie Nicks cancels gigs to 'keep healthy' as US Covid cases rise
item.description: The Fleetwood Mac singer, 73, is "still being extremely cautious" as the Delta variant spreads.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing: Tilly Ramsay and Greg Wise join line-up
item.description: Social media influencer Tilly Ramsay and actor Greg Wise join the TV dancing show's line-up.

item.title: Bilsdale transmitter fire: TV and radio for 1m off air indefinitely
item.description: The operators of a transmitter which serves part of northern England cannot say when it will be fixed.

item.title: I Am Legend screenwriter dismisses anti-vax claims based on film's plot
item.description: A sci-fi writer hits back at unfounded rumours that Covid jabs turn people into zombies.

item.title: Christina Applegate: US actress reveals MS diagnosis
item.description: The Dead To Me star says she was diagnosed with the condition a few months ago.

item.title: Drag queens Jodie Harsh and Bimini to host Radio 1 shows
item.description: Bimini, Tayce, Lawrence Chaney and Jodie Harsh will host on the Radio 1 Drag Day on 21 August.

item.title: China to ban karaoke songs with 'illegal content'
item.description: Songs that fall under this category include those that endanger national or territorial integrity.

item.title: Kate Clanchy: Author to rewrite memoir amid book's race and ableism row
item.description: Kate Clanchy says she "got many things wrong" amid anger over her award-winning 2019 memoir.

item.title: Vine's co-host Storm urges helmet use after bike crash
item.description: The Jeremy Vine show co-presenter says her helmet saved her when she was knocked down by a car.

item.title: Odeon owner AMC to accept payment in Bitcoin
item.description: Cinemagoers will be able to buy tickets and popcorn using the cryptocurrency, says the US chain.

item.title: The Orielles on turning their album into a film score
item.description: The band on surreal gigs at cricket grounds and the "happenings" that inspired their new project.

item.title: Fenty Beauty: How make-up helped Rihanna become a billionaire
item.description: Rihanna makes more money from her make-up than from her music and acting work.

item.title: Stephen Lawrence drama 'celebrates common decency'
item.description: Steve Coogan says it was an honour to play the man who helped convict two men for the teen's murder.

item.title: How TV's The Windsors is making its unregal stage debut
item.description: The creator and cast of the royal comedy satire take us behind the scenes of their West End show.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds: Why Free Guy is more than a 'video game movie'
item.description: The Canadian actor's latest film sees him play a different kind of "naïve and innocent" character.

item.title: Zola: How a road trip became a viral story of sex trafficking
item.description: The epic Twitter saga of a 19-year-old that attracted thousands of followers hits the big screen.

item.title: 'It just isn't sustainable' - Why touring in the EU is problematic for UK bands
item.description: One band explain what it's been like trying to tour in France in the age of Covid and Brexit.

item.title: Anything Goes: 'Olympian' efforts needed to launch London musical
item.description: The director of Anything Goes likens her cast to athletes as the Covid-defying production opens.

item.title: Fashion photographer: 'The world doesn't see this part of Afghanistan'
item.description: Fatimah Hossaini is a fashion photographer in Afghanistan and wants to use her work to help women be seen.

item.title: Peter Kay charity shows: Cancer patient 'honoured'
item.description: Sometimes laughter is all you've got, says Laura Nuttall, who is receiving treatment for brain cancer.

item.title: Sir Tom Stoppard: ‘Cancel culture has eroded free speech’
item.description: The playwright talks to Newsnight about the impact of cancel culture and his latest production Leopoldstadt.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Capturing the perfect moment
item.description: Three sports photographers explain what goes into getting the best shots of the day at the Games.

item.title: Tankus the Henge: Touring in France post-Brexit 'a puzzle'
item.description: Band Tankus the Henge negotiates touring in France, their first trip there since Brexit rules were imposed.

item.title: Becoming Tina Turner in London's West End
item.description: Aisha Jawando takes over from Adrienne Warren in the title role in the musical Tina.
